topic: Live Debate Viewer with Shareable Permalinks
conclusion: A real-time web interface that visualizes multi-agent debates as they happen, generating unique shareable URLs for each debate session. Extends the existing export/static_html.py artifact export system, adds WebSocket streaming to push rounds in real-time, and generates permalink slugs. Implementation scope: ~300 lines Python (WebSocket server + permalink generation), ~200 lines HTML/JS (viewer component).

topic: Airlock Resilience Layer for Agent Failures
conclusion: A defensive wrapper (AirlockProxy) for agents providing Circuit Breaking (timeouts via asyncio.wait_for) and Sanitization (null byte stripping, JSON repair). Transforms aragora from a fragile system that crashes when an agent fails, into a resilient system that observes failures and continues. Implementation in aragora/agents/airlock.py with injection via AgentFactory.

topic: Public Debate Archive with Stabilized IDs
conclusion: A system to expose completed debates publicly with stable, predictable IDs. Fixes the critical loop_id bug that breaks multi-loop scenarios. Creates natural growth loops through shareable debate replays. Minimal implementation (~150 LOC) building directly on existing infrastructure.

Refactor monolithic stream.py (2500+ LOC) into modular package structure: servers.py (WebSocket server classes), broadcaster.py (event broadcasting), state_manager.py (connection state), loop_manager.py (loop lifecycle), message_handlers.py (message routing), serializers.py (event serialization). Improves maintainability and testability.

Implement weighted voting based on ELO ratings and calibration scores. Agents with higher accuracy get more influence on final consensus. Support for judge-based, majority, and supermajority consensus modes. Early stopping when consensus threshold reached.

topic: Rate Limiting Strategy for Public APIs
conclusion: Implement token bucket algorithm with per-user quotas (120 req/min default), IP-based limiting for unauthenticated requests, and graduated throttling. Use sliding window counters stored in SQLite for persistence across restarts. Add X-RateLimit-* headers for client visibility. Critical for DoS prevention.

Centralized validation using Pydantic models for all API inputs. Implement SAFE_ID_PATTERN regex for path parameters, max length constraints (500 chars for topics, 100 for domains), and type coercion with bounded ranges. Sanitize all user content before database storage to prevent injection attacks.

Support both API key header auth (X-API-Key) and Bearer tokens. Implement constant-time comparison for token validation. Add token scoping for read-only vs write operations. Consider JWT for stateless auth with configurable expiry. Store hashed tokens only.

Use SQLite connection pool with min=2, max=10 connections. Enable WAL mode for better concurrent read performance. Set busy_timeout=5000ms to handle contention. Use context managers for automatic connection return. Monitor pool exhaustion with metrics.

Implement TTL-based caching for expensive queries: leaderboard (60s), consensus stats (30s), agent metrics (120s). Use LRU cache with max 1000 entries. Add cache invalidation on write operations. Include ETag headers for client-side caching. Monitor hit rates.

topic: Async Batch Processing for Debate Analytics
conclusion: Process debate analytics in background tasks using asyncio.gather with concurrency limits (max 5 parallel). Batch database writes (100 records per transaction). Use streaming for large result sets. Add progress callbacks for long-running operations.

topic: Integration Test Strategy for WebSocket Endpoints
conclusion: Use pytest-asyncio with aiohttp test client for WebSocket testing. Create fixtures for authenticated connections, mock agent responses, and debate state. Test reconnection handling, message ordering, and backpressure. Isolate tests with unique loop_ids.

topic: Mock Agent Framework for Unit Tests
conclusion: Create MockAgent class with configurable response delays, failure modes, and streaming behavior. Support deterministic responses via seed parameter. Add fixtures for common scenarios: timeout, rate limit, partial response. Enable replay of recorded agent sessions.

Use Hypothesis library for property-based testing of consensus mechanisms. Properties: idempotency (same input = same output), monotonicity (more agreement = higher confidence), boundedness (0.0-1.0 range). Generate random agent vote combinations.

Use pub/sub pattern with typed events (DebateEvent, AgentEvent, SystemEvent). Implement dead letter queue for failed event processing. Add event sourcing for replay capability. Use asyncio.Queue for backpressure management. Enable event filtering by type and source.

Define Agent protocol with generate(), stream(), and introspect() methods. Support dynamic loading via entry points. Provide base classes for common patterns (API agent, CLI agent). Add sandboxing for untrusted plugins. Include capability discovery mechanism.

Model debate phases as finite state machine: INIT -> PROPOSING -> CRITIQUING -> VOTING -> CONSENSUS -> COMPLETE. Define valid transitions and guards. Emit events on state changes. Support pause/resume with state serialization. Add timeout transitions.

Implement correlation IDs (debate_id + round_id + agent_id) propagated through all operations. Use structured logging with JSON format. Add span timing for each phase. Export traces to OpenTelemetry format. Enable sampling for high-volume production.

Add ARAGORA_DEBUG environment variable for verbose logging. Include agent prompts and full responses in debug mode. Log timing breakdowns for each phase. Add memory usage tracking. Enable request/response dumps for API debugging.

topic: Replay System for Debugging Failed Debates
conclusion: Record all debate events to JSONL files with timestamps. Support deterministic replay with mocked agent responses. Add step-through mode for interactive debugging. Include state snapshots at each round. Enable diff comparison between runs.

Use URL path versioning (/api/v1/, /api/v2/) for major breaking changes. Support Accept-Version header for minor versions. Maintain backward compatibility for 2 major versions. Add deprecation warnings in response headers. Document migration guides.

Return consistent error JSON: {error: string, code: string, details: object, request_id: string}. Use HTTP status codes correctly (400 validation, 401 auth, 403 forbidden, 404 not found, 429 rate limit, 500 internal). Include stack traces only in debug mode.

Use numbered migration files (001_initial.sql, 002_add_indexes.sql). Store applied migrations in _migrations table. Support rollback with down migrations. Run migrations on server startup. Add dry-run mode for testing. Lock during migration.

topic: Database Index Optimization for Common Queries
conclusion: Add composite indexes for frequent query patterns: (agent_name, timestamp) for history, (debate_id, round_num) for replay, (domain, confidence) for search. Use partial indexes for active records. Monitor slow queries and add indexes as needed.
